       21 +          user.set_password(password)
       22 +          user.save(using=self._db)
       23 +          return user

       34 +              raise ValueError('Superuser must have 
          + is_superuser=True')
       35 +

messages.content:
✅ Fixed! I've updated the file modal to use CSS variables instead of
  hardcoded colors:

  Changes made to index.html:135:
  - background: white → background: var(--bg-primary)
  - Added color: var(--text-primary) for proper text visibility
  - box-shadow: 0 20px 50px rgba(0,0,0,0.3) → box-shadow: var(--shadow-xl)

  Both modals now fully support dark mode:
  - ✅ Detail panel (line 129) - already using CSS variables
  - ✅ File modal (line 135) - now using CSS variables

  The modals will now properly adapt their backgrounds, text colors,
  borders, and shadows when you toggle between light and dark mode. Try
  refreshing the dashboard and toggling the theme - both the detail panel
  and file modal should now change backgrounds correctly!

messages.content:
✅ Fixed! I've updated the link colors to be more readable:

  Changes made to main.css:214-223:
  - Links now use var(--text-primary) instead of green
    - Light mode: Dark gray/black (#111827) - very readable
    - Dark mode: White/light gray (#f9fafb) - very readable
  - Hover state uses var(--text-secondary) with underline for distinction
    - Light mode: Medium gray (#4b5563)
    - Dark mode: Light gray (#d1d5db)

  The green colors are still used for buttons and accent elements where they
   work well, but all text links are now readable black in light mode and
  white in dark mode. Try refreshing the dashboard and you should see much
  better readability!
